intro: Cynoglossum paucisetum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. The plant has a short stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Boraginaceae family, often found in temperate regions.
